highlights.phrase: ï»¿This retired nurse from Watford
kept a pain relief secret hidden for months.
She never planned to share it with anyone.
But after what happened to her friend,
staying silent was no longer an option.
The story begins 14 months ago
when Emily, a retired nurse,
woke up one night to a big scare.
It felt like someone was stabbing her feet
with thousands of hot razor sharp needles,
while unpleasant numbness
spread throughout her toes.
A visit to the hospital revealed
she suffered a crippling neuropathic flare up
during the night,
when she asked the doctor for a cure,
all he did was prescribe her painkillers
and told her she would just have to
learn to live with the constant pain.
As a former nurse, Emily knew
the answer was not painkillers
because they only numb the pain
and don't address the real root cause of neuropathy.
So instead, Emily decided to try something completely different.
Working alongside her grandson,
an Oxford University graduate
who specialises in the nervous system,
they studied 134 patients with neuropathy
and found out the real root cause of neuropathic foot pain.
neuropathic foot pain.
It turns out that the nerve cells in our feet
are just like every other cell in our body.
They need a constant supply of oxygen and nutrients
to function properly.
However, as we get older,
our blood circulation starts to get worse
as our blood vessels naturally weaken.
This decline is first felt in the feet
as they are furthest from the heart.
This gets even worse if you are diabetic
because excess blood sugar causes the blood vessels to shrink,
further restricting blood flow.
Because of this, the oxygen supply to peripheral nerves
in the feet decreases,
leading to the nerve fibres being damaged.
This is what causes those burning pains,
those unbearable tingling sensations,
and those awful numbing neuropathic flare-ups.
The nerve cells in your feet are literally suffocating
and dying every day
because they are not getting an
adequate supply of oxygenated blood.
But there's hope.
The National Institute of Health published a study stating that
peripheral nerves have the ability to regenerate as long as the underlying nerve cell has not been killed.
If you're still feeling burning and tingling pain in your feet,
it's actually really good news
as it means your nerve cells are still alive
and have not been killed.
Taking all of this information into account,
Emily and her grandson worked on a way
to increase the blood flow in the feet
so that the nerve cells get the oxygen they need
The best way to increase circulation is moving around,
but we know that when you are in pain,
that's the last thing you want to do.
Another solution many people praise is physiotherapy
as it increases blood circulation around the feet.
around the feet.
But shortly after the session ends,
blood circulation levels drop,
forcing you to return again and again
and pay hundreds of pounds per week
to maintain the hamster wheel of relief.
That's when Emily and her grandson
knew exactly what they needed to do.
They needed to find a way to increase blood flow
not for a short time,
but for as long as you need.
All day, every day.
So together they designed
that could skyrocket blood flow around her feet
for as long as she needed.
And she couldn't believe what happened.
After just 15 minutes,
the numbness was replaced with a warm comfort
as the sensation she had lost returned to her feet.
falling asleep straight away
without her burning, stabbing pains flaring up.
Her pain was soothed
as a constant supply of oxygen and nutrients
started flowing throughout her feet,
fuelling the nerve regeneration process
and successfully alleviating the neuropathic pain in her feet.
But Emily didn't tell anyone.
She wasn't a businesswoman.
She wasn't trying to sell anything.
And honestly, she thought maybe she just got lucky.
Maybe it wouldn't work for anyone else.
So she kept it to herself.
Then, a few months later,
her close friend Margaret shared some terrifying news.
Margaret's doctor had just told her
that if her circulation didn't improve soon,
they would need to start discussing amputation.
Emily knew she had to do something.
hoping they would work for her too.
Two weeks later,
Margaret went back for her routine checkup.
Her doctor ran the usual tests
and couldn't believe the results.
Her circulation had improved significantly.
He asked her what she'd been doing differently.
Amputation was no longer being discussed.
Margaret wanted to tell everyone.
Emily resisted.
She kept saying they weren't scientists
and she wasn't trying to start a company.
But Margaret didn't listen.
She told her friends.
They told others.
Suddenly Emily was getting calls from people she'd never met,
begging her for help.
Her grandson finally convinced her.
He reminded her that people were losing their feet every day,
and she had something that could help.
He was right.
So Emily made a decision she never expected to make.
a UK medical startup,
and with the help of neuropathy experts
and product developers,
they finalised the design
and brought the solution to market.
that eliminates tingling,
burning, and stabbing
in just 14 days or less.
to the network of blood vessels that lie beneath it,
skyrocketing blood flow
throughout the feet all day long
so that starved nerves are able to repair and regenerate
as they are nourished with the oxygen and nutrients they depend on.
Under controlled testing at the Royal Surrey County Hospital,
the tingling, burning
and stabbing pains
of 296 of the 300 patients
in 14 days or less.
The best part?
or before going to bed,
delivering a constant flow of oxygen and nutrient-rich blood
as you go about your day.
to enhance blood flow three times more effectively
than ordinary solutions.
whether it's first thing in the morning
then go about your normal day.
As you notice your feet aren't bothered
by the tingling, burning, or stabbing pains
that usually trouble your feet.
Over the next 14 days,
you notice the pain slowly fading from your feet.
As the pain is drained
and swapped for a newfound sense of comfort,
they will eliminate your pain
It's why people across the UK
over the fleeting bandaid relief of prescription drugs.
It's no secret that these medications
only cover up the pain
and don't do anything to help the nerves regenerate.
Wouldn't you like to finally repair your starved nerve fibres
and stop neuropathy from forcing you
to become dependent on crutches or a wheelchair
as the progressive disease strips away your mobility?
Emily wants everyone to know about this new solution,
This is a great deal
and it might be taken down at any time,
Now I know what you're thinking.
Will it work for me?
Well, Emily wants purchasing to be completely risk free,
on all purchases.
Today, you either get rid of your neuropathic pain
in the next 90 days
or get a full refund.
That's just 90 days
that could completely change your life.

subtitle_sentences.text: ï»¿This retired nurse from Watford kept a
pain relief secret hidden for months.
She never planned to share it with anyone.
But after what happened to her friend,
staying silent was no longer an option.
The story begins 14 months ago when Emily, a retired nurse,
woke up one night to a big scare.
It felt like someone was stabbing her feet
with thousands of hot razor sharp needles,
while unpleasant numbness also spread throughout her toes.
A visit to the hospital revealed she suffered
a crippling neuropathic flare up during the night,
and when she asked the doctor for a cure,
all he did was prescribe her painkillers
and told her she would just have to learn
to live with the constant pain.
As a former nurse, Emily knew the answer was not painkillers
because they only numb the pain and
don't address the real root cause of neuropathy.
So instead, Emily decided to try something completely different.
Working alongside her grandson, an Oxford University graduate
who specialises in the nervous system,
they studied 134 patients with neuropathy
and found out the real root cause of neuropathic foot pain.
It turns out that the nerve cells in our feet
are just like every other cell in our body.
They need a constant supply of oxygen
and nutrients to function properly.
However, as we get older,
our blood circulation starts to get worse
as our blood vessels naturally weaken.
This decline is first felt in the feet
as they are furthest from the heart.
This gets even worse if you are diabetic
because excess blood sugar
causes the blood vessels to shrink,
further restricting blood flow.
Because of this, the oxygen supply
to peripheral nerves in the feet decreases,
leading to the nerve fibres being damaged.
This is what causes those burning pains,
those unbearable tingling sensations,
and those awful numbing neuropathic flare-ups.
The nerve cells in your feet are literally
suffocating and dying every day
because they are not getting an
adequate supply of oxygenated blood.
But there's hope.
The National Institute of Health published a study stating
that peripheral nerves have the ability to regenerate
as long as the underlying nerve cell has not been killed.
If you're still feeling burning and tingling pain in your feet,
it's actually really good news
as it means your nerve cells are
still alive and have not been killed.
Taking all of this information into account,
Emily and her grandson worked
on a way to increase the blood flow in the feet
so that the nerve cells get the oxygen they need
and the pain goes away for good.
The best way to increase circulation is moving around,
but we know that when you are in pain,
that's the last thing you want to do.
Another solution many people praise is physiotherapy
as it increases blood circulation around the feet.
But shortly after the session ends,
blood circulation levels drop,
forcing you to return again and again
and pay hundreds of pounds per week
to maintain the hamster wheel of relief.
That's when Emily and her grandson
knew exactly what they needed to do.
They needed to find a way to
increase blood flow around the feet,
not for a short time,
but for as long as you need.
All day, every day.
So together they designed a
one of a kind pair of compression socks
that could skyrocket blood flow
around her feet for as long as she needed.
Emily decided to test the socks herself.
And she couldn't believe what happened.
After just 15 minutes,
the numbness was replaced with a warm comfort
as the sensation she had lost returned to her feet.
Then later that day, she wore them to bed,
falling asleep straight away
without her burning, stabbing pains flaring up.
Her pain was soothed as a
constant supply of oxygen and nutrients
started flowing throughout her feet,
fuelling the nerve regeneration process
and successfully alleviating the
neuropathic pain in her feet.
But Emily didn't tell anyone.
She wasn't a businesswoman.
She wasn't trying to sell anything.
And honestly, she thought maybe she just got lucky.
Maybe it wouldn't work for anyone else.
So she kept it to herself.
Then, a few months later,
her close friend Margaret shared some terrifying news.
Margaret's doctor had just told her
that if her circulation didn't improve soon,
they would need to start discussing amputation.
Emily knew she had to do something.
She gave Margaret a pair of the socks,
hoping they would work for her too.
Two weeks later, Margaret went
back for her routine checkup.
Her doctor ran the usual tests
and couldn't believe the results.
Her circulation had improved significantly.
He asked her what she'd been doing differently.
Amputation was no longer being discussed.
Margaret wanted to tell everyone.
Emily resisted.
She kept saying they weren't scientists
and she wasn't trying to start a company.
But Margaret didn't listen.
She told her friends.
They told others.
Suddenly Emily was getting
calls from people she'd never met,
begging her for help.
And the socks kept working.
Her grandson finally convinced her.
He reminded her that people were
losing their feet every day,
and she had something that could help.
He was right.
Staying silent felt selfish.
So Emily made a decision she never expected to make.
She partnered with FlowFit,
a UK medical startup,
and with the help of
neuropathy experts and product developers,
they finalised the design and brought the solution to market.
They go by the name FlowFit Socks.
The latest innovation in compression therapy
that eliminates tingling, burning,
and stabbing neuropathic foot pain
in just 14 days or less.
The secret to FlowFit Socks' success
is the compression zone technology they use.
By using five different compression zones,
each zone applies the perfect amount of pressure
to the network of blood vessels that lie beneath it,
skyrocketing blood flow throughout the feet all day long
so that starved nerves are able to repair and regenerate
as they are nourished with
the oxygen and nutrients they depend on.
They crafted them using the latest cross woven
medical grade compression fabric
that has a unique shapewear property.
This means it moulds to the slightest contours of the feet.
Under controlled testing at the Royal Surrey County Hospital,
FlowFit's compression technology was able to soothe
the tingling, burning and stabbing pains
of 296 of the 300 patients
in 14 days or less.
The best part?
All you have to do is slip them on
in the morning or before going to bed,
and then the compression zone technology
will do all the work for you,
delivering a constant flow of
oxygen and nutrient-rich blood
as you go about your day.
FlowFit Socks are simply unmatched
by any ordinary compression socks in every category
as they are clinically proven to enhance blood flow
three times more effectively than ordinary solutions.
Simply put them on when your feet are most painful,
whether it's first thing in the morning or before going to bed,
then go about your normal day.
As you notice your feet aren't bothered
by the tingling, burning, or
stabbing pains that usually trouble your feet.
Over the next 14 days,
you notice the pain slowly fading from your feet.
As the pain is drained and
swapped for a newfound sense of comfort,
they will eliminate your pain in just 14 days or less.
It's why people across the UK are choosing FlowFit Socks
over the fleeting bandaid relief of prescription drugs.
It's no secret that these medications only cover up the pain
and don't do anything to help the nerves regenerate.
Wouldn't you like to finally repair your starved nerve fibres
and stop neuropathy from forcing you
to become dependent on crutches or a wheelchair
as the progressive disease strips away your mobility?
Emily wants everyone to know about this new solution,
so she has since tripled production
and is offering a 50% off welcome sale
for anyone who orders within the next 24 hours.
This is a great deal and it might be taken down at any time,
so it's best to act now.
Now I know what you're thinking.
Will it work for me?
Well, Emily wants purchasing to be completely risk free,
so she worked with FlowFit to offer
an industry leading 90 day pain relief or money back guarantee
on all purchases.
Today, you either get rid of your
neuropathic pain in the next 90 days
or get a full refund.
That's just 90 days that could completely change your life.
Grab yours now before the super low price is raised.
